meanings.definition: A system of writing used by the ancient Irish consisting of an alphabet of 20 characters formed by parallel strokes or notches cut across a stone or piece of wood.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Irish used ogams to write messages on stones.
meanings.sent2: Scholars study ogams to understand ancient Irish culture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun carved ogams on the wrong stone, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The ogams on the stone seemed to whisper secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The intricate ogams etched on the wood were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A single character or letter in the Ogam alphabet.
meanings.sent1: The ogams in the Ogam alphabet represent specific sounds.
meanings.sent2: She carefully copied each ogam onto her notebook for practice.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ogam looked lost among the other letters in the alphabet.
meanings.sent4: His handwriting resembled the elegant curves of an ogam.
meanings.sent5: The ogam stood out boldly on the page, demanding attention.
